Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY - the WORST place I've EVER stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LittleSnuffy
Reviews.Content: TRUST ME! DO NOT STAY HERE!! It was the biggest dive I've ever been too and was full of very suspicious characters. I was really scared and actually cried when I made it out of there alive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: missymoo85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel on 3 seperate occasions and we love it! The location is good,near to all of the hollywood attractions with a walgreens next door and macdonalds over the road. The carpark is quite small but we have never had any problems finding a space. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and huge for the price. Would always stay here when visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: J_Kim32761
Reviews.Content: Our bed sheet only covered top half of the mattress. No ventilation so everyone someone takes a shower, the whole place gets really humid. Lock didn't work properly. Also, breakfast was just packaged danish bread with coffee (small Styrofoam cups). Wireless was unstable. Too sketchy. Never going back. On our 2nd night we were awaken by the police sirens from the plaza across. At least the guy at the front was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelt of Cat Pee”
Reviews.Author: emmathewanderer
Reviews.Content: I guess it's never a great sign when you arrive to find your hotel room door propped open and all the windows in the room open too. However it was New Years Eve and we were having to get what we were given. The hotel staff and service were great and the location is perfect but the smell in the room was unbearable. After a while we thought it had gone and so shut the windows and got ready to go out. When we returned after our night out we almost gagged when we unlocked the door - it smelt very strongly of cat pee. Perhaps we were unlucky with the room but I wouldn't take the risk of staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, amazing staff, amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: PaddyMackel
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancee stayed here in the middle of April. Could not have asked for better service. We arrived pretty late, about 12am. Our room was still available, we checked in with no bother and had an amazing nights sleep. Room was huge, king size double bed, 2 bedside tables and 2 dressers. Huge bathroom, outstanding shower and bath combo. We booked a bus tour of LA the next day through the owners and instead of letting us walk, the owner gave us a ride to where the pickup point was. We were initially supposed to fly out around 11pm the following night; instead of carrying our bags round all day, we were allowed to leave them in the owner's living area. This was a great help. To cut a long story short, our tickets had been cancelled. After a quick phone call, we arrived back at 2am. No issues at all; shown back to our room and told we could stay as long as we needed to until our flight was sorted. Owners gave us directions on how to go and pick up our re-issued tickets. Really cannot recommend this hotel enough. Had the owners not been so accommodating, friendly and helpful, we would have been in serious difficulties. Enjoyed our stay here immensely and would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Xmenunite
Reviews.Content: Read bad reviews but was won over by the free parking. Most hotels in Hollywood have parking but you have to pay and it’s not on the premises. Entrance to parking lot was very narrow (only 1 car could barely get through) and there were only like 8 spots for the whole hotel. Check in was fast and easy. The room was very large and the internet (free) was fast. Room was very dim yet it had so many light switches scattered in the large room. The counters were very low and I had to keep going on my knees to look in the mirrors (I’m 5’8 which is not that tall). My window had a lovely view of a wall a few inches from the building. The bathroom seemed new and clean but the water temperature was not stable. The TV reception was bad and NBC was completely out during the Olympics! Staff didn’t have a solution for it. Luckily I had my DVR at home running or else I would have demanded my money back. Around 10:30pm a “lady” was banging at a door demanding her “things” from someone who refused to open the door. Staff tried to calm her down but she kept hitting the door and shouting crude things. By the looks of her she was a hooker. Staff called security/police to get her out but it took a long time before they were called. Staff also sunk to the woman’s level by saying profanities which was very unprofessional. The room was very dark which was nice when trying to sleep. In the morning, the parking situation was horrible. People parked in places that were not spots and they blocked me, my boyfriend and others from moving their cars. My boyfriend and I are locals and we had to go to work that morning. Staff was too busy addressing complaining guests to help out with getting our cars out. After 15 mins of careful maneuvering I got my car out and had to lend my car to my boyfriend so he could get to work on time after dropping me off. We had to race back to the hotel to get his car during our lunch (staff was nice enough to allow his car not to be towed during this time). We had a good time on this memorable Valentine’s Day night despite the hotel. We would not stay again ever.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sevilleUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, it was just i wanted, room very espacious and clean, the recepcion was not very knowledgebale about the area and other services but tried to be helpfull tho.. it was good enough for what we pay. the area was safe and central.

Reviews.Title: “Played count the sirens - Dirty, dark, pricey!”
Reviews.Author: randomholidayer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here so that we could see around hollywood, which i never knew beforehand was such a hole! The place was terrible but it was Labor Day and we didnt have much other options. Charge was 170ish dollars with tax, and the room, while very big, had bugs and was dirty as well. The curtains were broken and i had to fix them to close them, as the window looked out at the alley. Chose not to allow room service in as it just seemed like a really dodgy area, and was quite scary experience. Free internet was nice though, and the shower was excellent, but it does not make up for it! Would never recommend anyone to stay here ever ever ever. Get out of hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Scary place”
Reviews.Author: KittenFin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hollywood Star Inn couple of nights with my friends. I have to say for the first time in my life I was really scared. When we arrived to the Star Inn, the place looked really dodgy, the doors to the street n backyard were fully open. When we were checking in, a shemale walked in and asked us for money. Every single time we walked in or out both of the doors were open and we didn't see the staff anywhere. So basically anyone can walk in. The rooms were big but dim. I can't tell were they clean since I couldn't see there properly. One night a horrible screaming n shouting woke us up. A woman or shemale screamed and their room phone kept ringing. We were awake listening that almost an hour before security came. Soon LAPD arrived and then they started to discuss about the situation in the hallway. I still don't know what was that all about. That was the most horrible hotel/motel I've ever stayed in. I would never recommend this place for anybody and surprisingly I will never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “room got robbed and manager didn't care.”
Reviews.Author: pappap647
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the title, our room was robbed and the manager didnt care or help at all. Another room also got roobed that day. Breakfast is a wrapped up/ fat stuffed thing in a bag. coffee is with powdered milk. This is in a very dodgy area of hollywood and they leave the front and back doors open 24 hours and the receptions is unmanned a lot as they are always out back. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fluffy_steel
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget while in LA so the price suited but on arriving at the hotel we waited to check in behind a couple who had arrived, viewed their room and decided to leave. The hotel is cheap and I have seen worse area's of LA but I did feel quite unsafe while staying there mainly due to some of the dodgy looking guests. The front and back entrace to the hotel/motel are left wide open meaning anyone could walk in if and when they wanted to and the desk isn't manned 24hrs so the rooms are quite exposed. My friend and I ended up putting our suitcases across the door at night when we went to bed for extra security. The room itself was large enough and the cleanliness was okay, my one gripe was the sheet was too small for the bed so you would end up having the bare mattress underneath you during the night which was pretty gross. One a positive the location of the hotel is not too bad, close to Universal, Hollywood Bowl and so on. It also has a free car park at the back. I think if you are maybe a guy or a group of males not wanting to spend much then this would be okay for you but I really wouldn't recommend it to females staying on their own or anyone with kids. It just felt too unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, soso Area, Cleanliness ok”
Reviews.Author: fete
Reviews.Content: Well, it had been nice there...it had been the biggest room on our whole trip, the cleanliness was good enough... it´s not dirty though, but also you don´t feel like in a very clean and tidy place. Toilet and shower are old, heater is dusty, but no bed bugs, no hairs of someone else...! The location is pretty close to the Hollywood/Highland Center if you don´t mind to take the metro for 2 stations for only $1.50. Of course you can walk there, if you like to, we did so as well (BUT just ONCE!) The are where the hotel is located is not the best one, but definetly not the worst. We hadn´t had a weird feeling somewhere around, there are homeless people...like everywhere in the city. So actually it was nice and we liked it, because we didn´t expect too much for what we paid for a room of this size. The only fact I didn´t like was the guy of the reception... maybe I do him wrong and he had just a few bad days... but he hardly said a word the whole time, nothing to mention about the expression in his face... nothing to feel very welcome. But anyway, at least it still has been worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy area, but surprisingly good rooms”
Reviews.Author: getareaction
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed here for one night. This hotel is in a fairly rough area of Hollywood, but once we got inside we were impressed by the size and cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel has its own parking as well. It was only a short drive to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Griffith Observatory, and then we spent the evening in a wonderful dive bar just around the corner (I think it was called the White Horse). Recommended if you're looking for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Hollywood hotel”
Reviews.Author: RavenPolaris
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about staying in Hollywood proper (single woman travelling alone) and didn't have a lot of time to research hotels. So, I'd say I took a gamble on the Hollywood Star and I'm glad I did! I'll say that I don't need '4 star' establishments when I travel. I just want something clean, quiet, and well-located. This hotel fit the bill and more. Specific points worth mentioning: Parking--I was grateful for free parking near all the major Hollywood landmarks (some would call it a hike, but I like walking). I planned to stay in Hollywood until 4PM the afternoon of the day I checked out and asked the clerk if I could leave my car at the hotel. She just asked me how long and said 'no problem.' The room--Could have used some sprucing up, but it was clean and I was thrilled to have a refrigerator. The bathroom--WOW. It had obviously been redone very recently and was absolutely spotless and beautiful. It didn't even seem to fit the style of the hotel. Major points for this. The location--the Hollywood sights were several blocks away (walking distance for me) so some might not like that. There are tons of fastfood restaurants around the hotel (including a Denny's). I walked back to my hotel one night *after sundown* and felt safe. If I had to go back to Hollywood, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN AND SAFE”
Reviews.Author: Thiara
Reviews.Content: The stay in Hollywood Star Inn it is not so bad. The room was large and the bathroom was clean though towels were not enough for two people. Regarding parking when we arrived there were some injured cars in the parking behind the building and we were little afraid to leave the car here, but when we went back in the night the cars were disappear and the parking looks like safe and that's exactly as it was. We had two little problems. One just arrived with the room, they gave us the keys of two rooms and we could decide what we wanted of the two, but both were not ready although were the 3 PM. The second one with the room's key. The key often became demagnetized so we were forced to go to the reception where there ever was nobody and we had to wait. The location it is not so bad, you are just three Km from Chinese theater. If you want to visit the Universal Studios and the Warner Bros I suggest this place, obviously you have to get a car. If you want to go to the beach it is not a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: theroboman
Reviews.Content: I felt save leaving my car in the parking lot behind the building. The room was clean overall, exept for the chair had a big stain on it. The bathroom was clean with newer appliances. However, I had called 2 times to confirm my reservation, but nobody was able to assure my reservations, since I booked it through [-------] Anyway , it was important for me that I stayed in a clean and safe place that is resonably priced. I feel that I Hollywood Star Inn was able to deliver that and would recommend it to anyone on a budget.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Stars Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5435 West Sunset Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
